title: 107_hr5626
content: The text chunk discusses the revision of tax treatment of derivative transactions entered into by a corporation with respect to its stock under Section 1032 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The text chunk explains that no gain or loss is recognized by a corporation when receiving property or services in exchange for its stock. It also discusses the nonrecognition treatment of Section 1032 derivative items in determining the corporation's tax liability. The text chunk defines items excluded from a corporation's tax liability, such as obligations under contracts related to the corporation's stock or reflecting changes in stock value. It excludes deductions for compensation or under specific sections. The text chunk discusses income recognition on forward contracts entered into by a corporation when acquiring its stock, treating the excess amount under the contract as original issue discount on a debt. The text chunk explains that if a corporation enters into a forward contract within a specific timeframe before acquiring its stock, the acquisition is presumed to be part of a plan unless proven otherwise. The text chunk defines a forward contract and includes regulations for treating treasury stock as stock. The Secretary will prescribe regulations to carry out the section's purposes, including treating certain instrument portions separately. Basis for property acquired by a corporation in exchanges for its stock is also addressed. The text chunk amends the item relating to section 1032 in the table of sections for part III of subchapter O of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to transactions entered into after the date of the enactment of this Act.
